meanings.definition: A lively and playful musical composition or movement.
meanings.sent1: The orchestra played a cheerful scherzo that made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent2: Mozart's symphony includes a delightful scherzo that always brings a smile to my face.
meanings.sent3: The pianist added a funny scherzo to the concert program to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The scherzo in the symphony was like a burst of joy in the midst of a storm.
meanings.sent5: The lively scherzo painted a vivid picture of children playing in a sunny meadow.

meanings.definition: A humorous or light-hearted joke or prank.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's scherzo had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: Playing a scherzo on his friend was all in good fun.
meanings.sent3: The playful scherzo caught everyone off guard and brought smiles all around.
meanings.sent4: Her witty scherzo was like a breath of fresh air in the serious meeting.
meanings.sent5: The clever scherzo was a memorable moment that lightened the mood.
